page.title: 06EDUCATION IN HIGHAM FERRERS
page.content: The FERRERS SCHOOL is a mixed comprehensive for 11-18 year olds with 742 pupils on roll. It is a single storey building which although only 5 years old is already overcrowded, with mobiles all over the place. There is no corporal punishment and rules are not all that strict. However all pupils are expected to wear a smart blue uniform with a tie and school badge showing the town shield. The teachers are good and easy to get on with and most are very young. There are plenty of lunchtime and after school activities which many pupils attend e.g.sport and hobby clubs. Following a survey of 2nd year pupils it was found that the most popular lesson was Maths and the least popular was German. New subjects include;Control Technology, Electonics & Computers.
